annotation.TEXT: Update: The coin counter will actually count up by 1 every 2 frames if the coin display is â‰¤70, but count up by 1 every 1 frame if the coin display is >70.

Clarification: Each of the 120 stars in the game has a specific bit in memory that's 0 if that star's never been collected, and 1 if that star has been collected. When you collect a star, that star's bit is set to 1 (even if it's already 1), and then the total amount of 1 bits its summed up and the star count is updated to that sum. So collecting SL's 100 coin star over and over (even though the star's yellow) just sets that star's bit to 1 over and over, and so it doesn't affect the star count after the star's been collected once already. That's why we can't exceed 120 stars, NOT because the star count is capped at 120.
